page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: Most of the land in this area is farmland, and most of this farmland is arable land which is under cultivation. The main crops grown are barley, wheat, potatoes, sugar beet and oilseed rape. However, a fair amount of livestock is reared on the farms. There are several fields of fertilised grassland which is cut for silage and hay and fed to the animals. Several more fields are enclosed rough grazing land, used as pasture. It appears to be a very fertile area with a light sandy soil that it very productive. Even the old pit tips have been contoured, covered in soil and cultivated. Most is used as pasture, but one farmer has grown a crop of barley on an old pit tip.
